page.title: 13FARMING in SPEY VallEY (3)
page.content: As the farms here lie close to, if not in, the flood plain of the Spey Valley the risk of{flooding}is constant. The spey waters are held back at{the Spey {Dam,}some 12 miles upriver and if the overflow gates are opened due to a build up there a sudden heavy flow ensues. The police are then notified and a{flood warning telephone system instigated. A call at 4 a.m. is not unusual and farmers may have to venture out to ensure their livestock will be safe. To round up and count seventy head of cattle on a dark stormy night requires a special dedication and, of course, his whole livelihood depends on this commitment. His work is a{seven day week}job although once the livestock is attended to in the mornings time can be found for market, shopping or an occasional game of curling in Aviemore
